results.title: Women in the surf (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women coming into a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calendar and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Johnno is 10 years of age, deaf and always in strife. He lives in a small fishing town and he has an affinity with the sea that he shares with Tony, an Italian fisherman, whom the townsfolk also ridicule. Johnno’s best friend is his sister, Julie, who is going away to boarding school in the city. When Johnno discovers this news he is devastated and runs away to his secret place - a deserted island. Johnno’s running away causes much havoc in the small community and the experience helps him realise that he must learn to live with his deafness and trust those who love him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Winners: Room to Move
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Richard Mason, Julia Overton, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a top runner, coached by her father day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance, but Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed. She rebels and plans a new life for herself, but the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got.

Cast includes Nicole Kidman, Terence Donovan and Alyssa Cook.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Duigan, Richard Mason, Julia Overton, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Winners: Top Kid
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Bob Ellis, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a bright boy - a bit too bright for his own good, as the other kids try to prove by beating him up regularly after school. Then he goes on a quiz show and suddenly fame and fortune are within his reach… until they start to rig the show and Gary has to make a very difficult decision.

Cast includes Emil Minty, Harold Hopkins, Michelle Fawdon and Garry McDonald.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Bob Ellis, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Winners: The Paper Boy
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Bob Ellis, Jane Ballantyne, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.

Cast includes Christopher Schlusser, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Linden Wilkinson.

results.title: Winners: On Loan
results.creator_credit: Anne Brooksbank, Geoffrey Bennett, Jane Scott, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
At her 14th birthday party Lindy wishes she knew her actual birth date. But only her real parents would know, and they’re both dead. Or so Lindy and her Australian family think until a letter from her natural father arrives. Now she must decide between two families and two futures, between Australia and Vietnam.

Cast includes Marillac Johnston, John Walton and Belinda Giblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anne Brooksbank, Geoffrey Bennett, Jane Scott, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
